125gr to make 23 x 13 x 7 cm 4 0mm crochet hook if you use other yarn use the recommended hook size magnet button a pair of scissors tapestry needle stitch marker chain strap optional abbreviation chain chain single_crochet single_crochet double_crochet double_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch increase increase sts stitches magic_ring magic_ring bl back loop fl front loop vivreflou 1 layout & measurements this bag is made from three panels the front panel the back and flap panel and the side and base panel it s a make to measure project so you can adjust it to any size you want using any yarn and its recommended hook size front use this panel as your guide to decide how many front stitches and row you need for your desired size side & base make a chain until side you reach the width you want & then build up the row until the stitch count matches the front back base panel & back & cover start the same way cover as the front panel make about double the row of the front panel then add a few extra row so the flap fully covers the side panel 1 vivreflou front panel to make this bag you need to chain multiple of 6 plus 1 then add 1 more as turning chain this gonna be the length of the bag r1 single_crochet skip 2 5 double_crochet into 1 sts skip 2 single_crochet r2 chain 3 count as double_crochet 2 double_crochet skip 2 single_crochet skip 2 5 double_crochet into 1 sts skip 2 single_crochet 3 double_crochet r3 single_crochet skip 2 5 double_crochet into 1 sts skip 2 single_crochet repeat r2-3 until you get the height that you want make sure to end it with row 2 pattern when you reach the height you want chain 1 and start making single_crochet around the edge make 2 single_crochet in each double_crochet and 1 single_crochet in each single_crochet place a marker at the top corner then count the stitches between the markers we ll call that number a for reference i made 31 chains 10 row in height and have 61 single_crochet stitches between the marker 2 vivreflou
